Filters

Filters are much like hooks, except these simply allow you to make minor and much simpler changes to the system, by allowing you to change a value, such as a URL, page name, and so on.

Summary
FiltersFilters are much like hooks, except these simply allow you to make minor and much simpler changes to the system, by allowing you to change a value, such as a URL, page name, and so on.

theme_title

themes/default/implemented_theme.class.php

$api->apply_filter('theme_title', (!empty($this->title) ? htmlchars($this->title). ' - '

themes/default/implemented_theme.class.php

$api->apply_filter('theme_site_name', $settings->get('site_name'))

captcha_bg_red

plugins/captcha/captcha.php

$api->apply_filter('captcha_bg_red', 255)

login_view_function

core/checkcookie.php

$api->apply_filter('login_view_function', 'login_view')

core/checkcookie.php

$api->apply_filter('login_view_path', $core_dir. '/login.php')

core/register.php

$api->apply_filter('registration_submit_url', $base_url. '/index.php?action=register2')

$api->apply_filter('login_message', '')

core/core.php

$api->apply_filter('output_callback', null)
